get.description: Retrieve a list of Charging Stations

200.description: Charging Station has been successfully deleted

570.description: Charging Station can't be deleted due to existing active transactions

connectorId.description: Required. This contains the id of the connector to be reserved. A value of 0 means that the reservation is not for a specific connector.

expiryDate.description: Required. This contains the date and time when the reservation ends.

idTag.description: Required. The identifier for which the Charge Point has to reserve a connector.

reservationId.description: Required. Unique id for this reservation.

200.description: Charging Station has been successfully reserved

type.description: Required. This contains the type of reset that the Charge Point should perform.

200.description: Charging Station has been successfully reset
Charging Station cache has been successfully cleared

reservationId.description: Required. Id of the reservation to cancel.

vendorId.description: Mandatory. Vendor of the charging station.

200.description: Data Transfer has been successfully executed

key.description: Optional. List of keys for which the configuration value is requested.

tagID.description: The identifier that Charge Point must use to start a transaction.

visualTagID.description: The identifier that Charge Point must use to start a transaction.

connectorId.description: Optional. Number of the connector on which to start the transaction. connectorId SHALL be > 0

transactionId.description: Required. The identifier of the transaction which Charge Point is requested to stop.

connectorId.description: Required. The ID of the Connector for which the schedule is requested. When ConnectorId=0, the Charge Point will calculate the expected consumption for the grid connection.

duration.description: Required. Time in seconds. length of requested schedule

chargingRateUnit.description: Optional. Can be used to force a power or current profile

location.description: Required. This contains the location (directory) where the diagnostics file shall be uploaded to.

retries.description: Optional. This specifies how many times Charge Point must try to upload the diagnostics before giving up. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how many times it wants to retry.

retryInterval.description: Optional. The interval in seconds after which a retry may be attempted. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how long to wait between attempts.

startTime.description: Optional. This contains the date and time of the oldest logging information to include in the diagnostics.

stopTime.description: Optional. This contains the date and time of the latest logging information to include in the diagnostics.

location.description: Required. This contains a string containing a URI pointing to a location from which to retrieve the firmware.

retrieveDate.description: Required. This contains the date and time after which the Charge Point is allowed to retrieve the (new) firmware.

retries.description: Optional. This specifies how many times Charge Point must try to download the firmware before giving up. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how many times it wants to retry.

retryInterval.description: Optional. The interval in seconds after which a retry may be attempted. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how long to wait between attempts.

connectorId.description: Required. The id of the connector for which availability needs to change. Id '0' (zero) is used if the availability of the Charge Point and all its connectors needs to change.

type.description: Required. This contains the type of availability change that the Charge Point should perform.

ForbiddenError.description: Not authorized to execute this operation

BackendError.description: Unexpected Backend error, checks the Logs

TagHasTransactionsError.description: Cannot change user or delete a tag having transactions

chargingProfileId.description: Required. Unique identifier for this profile.

transactionId.description: Optional. Only valid if ChargingProfilePurpose is set to TxProfile, the transactionId MAY be used to match the profile to a specific transaction.

stackLevel.description: Required. Value determining level in hierarchy stack of profiles. Higher values have precedence over lower values. Lowest level is 0.

chargingProfilePurpose.description: Required. Defines the purpose of the schedule transferred by this message.

chargingProfileKind.description: Required. Indicates the kind of schedule.

recurrencyKind.description: Optional. Indicates the start point of a recurrence.

validFrom.description: Optional. Point in time at which the profile starts to be valid. If absent, the profile is valid as soon as it is received by the Charge Point.

validTo.description: Optional. Point in time at which the profile stops to be valid. If absent, the profile is valid until it is replaced by another profile.

duration.description: Optional. Duration of the charging schedule in seconds. If the duration is left empty, the last period will continue indefinitely or until end of the transaction in case startSchedule is absent.

startSchedule.description: Optional. Starting point of an absolute schedule. If absent the schedule will be relative to start of charging.

chargingRateUnit.description: Required. The unit of measure Limit is expressed in.

chargingSchedulePeriod.description: Required. List of ChargingSchedulePeriod elements defining maximum power or current usage over time. The startSchedule of the first ChargingSchedulePeriod SHALL always be 0.

startPeriod.description: Required. Start of the period, in seconds from the start of schedule. The value of StartPeriod also defines the stop time of the previous period.

limit.description: Required. Charging rate limit during the schedule period, in the applicable chargingRateUnit, for example in Amperes or Watts. Accepts at most one digit fraction (e.g. 8.1).

numberPhases.description: Optional. The number of phases that can be used for charging. If a number of phases is needed, numberPhases=3 will be assumed unless another number is given.

minChargeRate.description: Optional. Minimum charging rate supported by the electric vehicle. The unit of measure is defined by the chargingRateUnit. This parameter is intended to be used by a local smart charging algorithm to optimize the power allocation for in the case a charging process is inefficient at lower charging rates. Accepts at most one digit fraction (e.g. 8.1)
